text: Madhopur is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Madhopur. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch, who is an elected representative. == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Madhopur has total number of 225 houses and population of 1,165 of which include 603 males and 562 females. Literacy rate of Madhopur is 81.03%, higher than state average of 75.84%. The population of children under the age of 6 years is 121 which is 10.39% of total population of Madhopur, and child sex ratio is approximately 754, lower than state average of 846. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" !
